meanings.definition: Having the power to annul or revoke a contract or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The rescissory clause allowed them to cancel the deal.
meanings.sent2: The rescissory terms were clearly outlined in the agreement.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly referred to her rescissory authority as the 'undo button'.
meanings.sent4: The rescissory nature of the decision was like erasing a mistake.
meanings.sent5: The rescissory ability of the judge made him a powerful figure in contract disputes.

meanings.definition: A legal action or remedy to cancel or void a contract.
meanings.sent1: He filed a rescissory claim to nullify the agreement.
meanings.sent2: The rescissory process can be complex and time-consuming.
meanings.sent3: The rescissory paperwork was finally completed after weeks of back and forth.
meanings.sent4: The rescissory action was like hitting the reset button on the contract.
meanings.sent5: The rescissory case set a precedent for future legal disputes.

meanings.definition: Capable of rescinding or undoing a previous action.
meanings.sent1: Her rescissory decision reversed the course of events.
meanings.sent2: The rescissory power vested in him allowed for quick corrections.
meanings.sent3: The rescissory ability to turn back time was a popular topic in science fiction.
meanings.sent4: The rescissory impact of his words changed the outcome dramatically.
meanings.sent5: The rescissory function of the software saved them from a major error.
